fields.description:
I tried to remove a couple of dependant builds from a particular build by unchecking the relevant checkboxes.  After I submitted, the builds were still there.

On 0.10, none of the checkboxes were checked.
fields.summary: Checkboxes dont work properly when removing dependant builds

fields.description:
Today Sam and I hit a weird failure in Tangosol that we haven't seen before. We wanted to search all the logs and test results of our Confluence acceptance test builds to see if it has happened anywhere before.

Give me a search box on the front page that searches all the content in Bamboo. Some ideas for stuff that should be possible:

- project, plan and build keys should jump to the summary page
- a test class name should list the plans which have results for a test with that name
- usernames or full names of users could do something.

I'm sure there's more.

Anyway, you need a search bar. At a minimum it should index all the test output.
fields.summary: Search everything
Split webapp WAR module into a JAR and a WAR modulde

fields.description: The script builder in Windows checks for the script file without the running directory, so it thinks it can't find the script
fields.summary: Script builder fails for windows

fields.description: When a build is triggered, it will only build if something has changed. Sometimes you want to be able to add file patterns to ignore for files that you don't build even if it's changed. (So you can check files in as a post process with the Bamboo build number in it).
fields.summary: Ability to ignore file patterns for updates

fields.description: Currently if there are errors checking out source for a project (due to CVS connectivity problems for example), the notifications that get sent out just say the the Build Failed.  It would be better, if the build would simply not run in this case, and a notification gets sent out stating that connection to SCM wasn't possible.
fields.summary: Don't report builds as failed if a connection to SCM fails

fields.description:
The CVS log message for [CONF-MAIN-1282|http://keg.sydney.atlassian.com:8080/bamboo/browse/CONF-MAIN-1282] had newlines between each sentence. The Bamboo code change screen looks a bit funny because it doesn't replace a new line with an HTML
. See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Show new lines in code change log messages
Builds list for reports doesn't use the "pretty username"

fields.description:
The builds should be sorted by date (latest first).

I thought we'd fixed this? Perhaps it was a problem with with the paging code. Need to investigate.
fields.summary: Reports build table not sorted

fields.description:
Technically, a cancelled build is neither failed nor successful. You need a different result type for this build.

As for colour, I'd suggest grey on the build summary page, and black on the dashboard.
fields.summary: A cancelled build should not be a failure

fields.description: Favourites should be automatically for users if they commit to a project
fields.summary: Auto favourite functionality

fields.description: Create a custom plugin which tags the build if an out of memory error has been detected.
fields.summary: Sample plugin: Out of Memory tagging

fields.description: There should be a tab displaying the most recent build in Bamboo, which should be be filterable
fields.summary: Add Recent Activity tab for the dashboard
Breadcrumbs should have build numbers
Reports on top ten longest time to fix for tests
Test summary page still using the old style

fields.description:
The build summary page should display the test cases from the author's perspective. eg. it groups the test cases by who is responsible for them.

We can reuse the UI look and feel for current test cases, and make sure that you can flip between the two views (since both can be useful). Maybe it can just be another tab.
fields.summary: Test reponsibility for a build summary
Link tests with corresponding file in FishEye

fields.description: Currently goes to the dashboard, but should probably go to the Plan Summary page
fields.summary: Redirect after a plan is created

fields.description:
IE caches the request for ajax content.

When submitting new comments and labels, the new content does not show up.
fields.summary: IE caches ajax response for comments and labels

fields.description: Some users have asked for support for the ClearCase repository
fields.summary: Support for ClearCase
Last screen of create build broken on Safari

fields.description: The *Attic* has been removed from the path, but it should also be removed from the display UI part of it as well.
fields.summary: Code change filenames from CVS branch have "Attic" in the display path

fields.description:
People want the ability to be able to automatically tag a build after it completes successfully. e.g tagging a build as LATEST_SUCCESSFUL when it completes successfully.

That way, other tools / users can always point the tag for the latest successful builds
fields.summary: Add the ability to automatically tag the source repository

fields.description: Reloading the page every time you add a favourite means it takes about 10 minutes to add all my favourites on panda. A major hassle.
fields.summary: AJAXify favourites

fields.description:
Once BAM-613 is implemented, allow me to mark the 'Confluence' project as my favourite, not every individual plan.

Actually, favourites might make more sense only at the Project level. Rarely are you interested in only one plan in a project. Definitely worth a discussion once the dashboard shows the hierarchy correctly.
fields.summary: Let favourites be set at the Project level as well as the Plan

fields.description:
Despite the fact that dependent builds and scheduled builds aren't trigged by a code change, Bamboo should keep track of the code changes it received when it runs the update from the version control system.

For example:

1. Bamboo builds FOO-DEF-1 as a clean checkout. No code changes known.
2. Bamboo gets FOO-DEF-2 triggered as a dependent build.
3. Bamboo runs 'cvs up' in FOO-DEF build directory. Output of CVS includes files which are updated. Bamboo should capture this list and show them as code changes, exactly the same as for a code-change-triggered build.

The same is possible for scheduled build. A nightly build should show a list of all changes from the last day.
fields.summary: Capture code changes for dependent and scheduled builds

fields.description:
Don't know how practical this would be, but if I have a build with multiple artifacts, if one fails the likelihood is they'll all fail. If such happens, and I have say 3 artifacts, I don't really want to be greeted with 3 errors on the dashboard, I'd rather have one.

As I say, if it's not practical then don't worry about it, clearly if there are single failures I still want to know as it may be one of my artifacts is incorrectly configured, but if the build fails then I won't expect any artifacts to be built

Maybe it shouldn't try to do the build artifacts if the build fails?
fields.summary: When a build fails I only want 1 error for artifacts

fields.description:
Plans should be grouped by project on the dashboard for readability and clearer design.

It makes the project concept much more useful.
fields.summary: Display project, plan hierarchy on dashboard

fields.description:
In the build configuration screen, there's a label:

"What do should builds completed be labelled as?"

It should be written as:

"What should completed builds be labelled as?"

Or even better in the declarative:

"Label all successful builds"
fields.summary: Label grammar

fields.description:
Currently plan keys must be 3 or more characters. You should allow two characters, I think, given the whole length of the identifier is longer than JIRA.

E.g.: CONF-TM-387
fields.summary: Allow two character plan keys

fields.description:
Test output logs are escaped in HTML one too many times. So you end up with this:

http://panda:8080/bamboo/build/viewBuildResultsTests.action?buildKey=CONFTPC-RAND&buildNumber=31

"Expected text 'Test Spring Component' not found in response '<html>
<head>
    <title>Plugin Manager - Confluence</title>
    ..."

What it should be is this:

"Expected text 'Test Spring Component' not found in response '<html>
<head>
    <title>Plugin Manager - Confluence</title>
    ...."
fields.summary: HTML in test output log is doubly-escaped

fields.summary: Invalid path to clover throws error

fields.description:
Expose not only the latest build results (getLatestBuildResults - as an aside, the pluralisation of this call signature seems dubious to me), but also the latest successful build results (or alternatively getBuildResults (n) which acquires n more recent builds.

We'd like to be able to determine, via the API, what the last successful build was.  If this is different to what we're already running, we'd then go and rebuild and deploy this  into different environments.
Our environmental complexity causes us issues sometimes!

Related to BAM-604, but not dependant on.
fields.summary: API access to last successful build

fields.description:
It would be very useful if a build stored the SCM build identifier (i.e. SVN revision, CVS date, P4 revision) that a given build was checked out with.

This could then be used by 
 * anyone wishing to recreate a given build
 * an integration server to build and deploy the software when the build succeed (our environment is complex, and the servers doing CI are not in the same location as the integration servers which live in our datacentre). While we could cobble together 

This is related to my commentary on BAM-61; although reading that is not mandatory to understand my request.
fields.summary: API access to the SCM repository's build identifier for a given build
Accessing /api/index.action throws a freemarker error

fields.description:
1. Spelling mistake - "Bamboo will create a javascipt file that will display the current status of the build. This script can then be embedded in an html page." - javascipt should be javascript
2. href="http://ci.radarnetworks.com/bamboo-status.css" css link is wrong - should be styles/bamboo-status.css
3. The template for the script should ideally replace BUILD-KEY with the appropriate build key - just for simpler cut and paste.
4. The page should note that the .js won't be created until the next build completes (it confused me, it will confuse others!)
fields.summary: Minor issues with the build status wizard section on the editBuildConfiguration.action page
Can't add or edit label

fields.description:
After upgrading from 0.6 to 0.9, all of my builds are named with an extra "-MAIN" in the build key.  I must have been clairvoyant because I already had named all my builds with a "-MAIN", so that they are now named "-MAIN-MAIN".  This seems to cause problems (e.g., stack trace below), because I am now unable to browse any builds.

I'm about to wipe the slate clean and recreate the builds, but if you have any suggestions it would be nice to keep the several weeks of build history that we've accumulated.

{noformat}
Version: 0.9
Build: 130
Build Date: Dec 21, 2006

Stack Trace: javax.servlet.ServletException: UrlRewriteFilter only supports servlet paths in the form "PROJECT[-BUILD][-BUILD_RESULT]". URI:/browse/PAC-BACKEND-MAIN-MAIN/latest

fields.description:
From: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257238866

An example:

SimpleLibraryA depends on nothing
CoreLibraryB depends on SimpleLibraryA
WebAppC depends on CoreLibraryB AND SimpleLibraryA
WebAppD depends on CoreLibraryB

So, if a change to SimpleLibraryA is checked in, I'd want Bamboo to do the following:
a) add SimpleLibraryA to the top of the build queue
b) add CoreLibraryB to the build queue AHEAD of WebAppC
c) add WebAppC to the build queue behind CoreLibraryB
d) when CoreLibraryB builds successfull, add WebAppD to the build queue

At the momoment, the build would be added arbitrary order.
fields.summary: Dependencies should handle more complex cases

fields.description:
Reasons why 'Default' is better than 'Main Build':

1. The latter uses the word 'build' which it isn't.
2. 'Default' is a better name than 'main'. This plan always starts as the default, but main doesn't really make sense for projects like Confluence. Every build in the project is as important as the others.
3. If we simply replace 'main' with 'default' and 'build' with 'plan', it has a redundant word ('plan') when shown with a heading or used in a sentence:

Web UI: "Plan: *Default Plan*"
IM message: "Build 1029 for Confluence project, *Default Plan* plan failed."

Both the above would be better without 'Plan' in the default name:

Web UI: "Plan: *Default*"
IM message: "Build 1029 for Confluence project, *Default* plan failed."

4. Encourages words that are simple adjectives for plan names. For example:

Web UI: "Plan: Functional Test"
IM message: "Build 1029 for Confluence project, Functional Test plan failed."
fields.summary: Default plan should be called 'Default' rather than 'Main build'
